User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.17) Gecko/20110414 Lightning/1.0b2 Thunderbird/3.1.10

In previous versions of Thunderbird detaching an attachement greyed out the attachment. Now it replaces the attachment with another 1kb file with a message but doesn't change the attached file icon in anyway. It is therefore possible to detach a file and then detach the Thunderbird message and write over the original file with the thunderbird message file.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Send yourself an email with an attachment
2.Use detach or detach all to detach the message and save it to your desktop for example
3.Then repeat 2 and the file on your desktop with be a message file from Thunderbird sayin the you have already detached the file, give the original file name but no way of getting the original file back.

Actual Results:  
lost original attachmenst

Expected Results:  
it should not be possible to detach a file twice - a warning should come up to tell the user that the original file has been detached or go back to the previous version where a detached file was greyed out and could not be accessed
comments.author: m.r.jolly@bham.ac.uk
